comments.body: Is this ever possible? `result` indicate retries needed while `pendingTxnOffsetCommits.isEmpty()`?
This is where we complete the result if there are no errors.

Do you think it would make sense to put an `if (!errors.isEmpty())` check around this log line for the cases when there are no errors? If I see it correctly it'd print `Received TxnOffsetCommit response for consumer group my-consumer-group:` which is I think is a bit misleading, and also I suppose it would be empty most of the times.
The `errors()` method name is a little misleading. The map contains both the successful partitions as well as those that failed. Most of the time, we would just see `Errors.NONE`.
Ok, I think I see now, thanks for the explanation.
